questions.question:
A security officer at a financial institution wants to ensure that all S3 buckets in the account are configured according to the companyâ€™s security standards, such as enabling server-side encryption and blocking public access. The institution also requires continuous monitoring and real-time alerts if any bucket becomes non-compliant.

Which AWS services should be used to meet these requirements?
options: Use AWS CloudTrail to track S3 API calls and alert if encryption or public access settings are changed.
Set up CloudWatch Alarms for changes in S3 bucket configurations, including encryption and access control policies.
Configure AWS Config to evaluate S3 bucket settings against security rules and set up CloudWatch Events for real-time alerts.
Use CloudWatch Logs to monitor S3 bucket changes and deploy Lambda functions to automatically correct misconfigurations.
correct_answers: Configure AWS Config to evaluate S3 bucket settings against security rules and set up CloudWatch Events for real-time alerts.
